content.raw: --varFloor should be used in conjunction with -zscore. In that case, a varFloor of 0.001 means that the variance cannot drop below 0.1% of the track's original variance, regardless of the normalization and of the original units. It would be reasonable to require --zscore when --varFloor is used. I think it would also be reasonable to make --zscore default.
